episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including the invention of the underwater ejector seat, a school in Massachusetts with perpetually lit light bulbs, a man who cornered the onion market in America, and a humorous story about Steve Jobs' autograph. The hosts delve into these facts with their usual humor and curiosity, exploring the historical and technical details behind each story.

facts.fact: The man who invented the underwater ejector seat once broke his tailbone in six places while testing the system on the ground rather than in the water.
There is a school in Massachusetts that has had all of its 7,000 light bulbs permanently on for over a year and a half now because no one knows how to turn them off.
In 1955, one person secretly bought almost all the onions in America.
In 1983, an autograph hunter wrote to Steve Jobs. Jobs replied saying that he didn't sign autographs, but he signed that letter and it's sold last year for half a million dollars.
